input: We're building a Spring Boot 3.2 application. Database: PostgreSQL. We need a DAO layer for a User entity. Fields: id (Long), email (String), name (String), createdAt (LocalDateTime). Use NamedParameterJdbcTemplate. Use constructor injection throughout.
Add a method to find user by email. Return Optional<User>.
Add findAll with pagination support. Use offset and limit parameters.
Now add the UserService layer. It should use the UserDao we just built. Use constructor injection.
Add transaction management to the service. Use @Transactional appropriately — read-only on queries, writable on mutations.
The service needs to handle the case where a user with that email already exists. Throw a custom exception.
Create the custom exception classes we need — one for duplicate email, one for user not found.
Add a UserController with REST endpoints — GET /users/{id}, POST /users, GET /users.
Add Bean Validation to the POST /users request body. Validate email format and name not blank.
Add a GlobalExceptionHandler that handles our two custom exceptions and Bean Validation errors, returning appropriate HTTP status codes.
